meanings.definition: Suitable or proper in the circumstances
meanings.sent1: Wearing pajamas to bed is appropriate.
meanings.sent2: It is appropriate to say 'thank you' when someone helps you.
meanings.sent3: It was not appropriate to wear a swimsuit to a job interview.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was appropriate for the joyous occasion.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile was appropriate for the happy news she shared.

meanings.definition: To take for one's own use, typically without the owner's permission
meanings.sent1: He tried to appropriate his friend's toy without asking.
meanings.sent2: The thief decided to appropriate the valuable painting from the museum.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to appropriate her sister's dessert.
meanings.sent4: The villain's plan was to appropriate the treasure for himself.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain wanted to appropriate the enemy ship for his crew.

meanings.definition: To allocate (money or resources) for a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: The government will appropriate funds for the new school building.
meanings.sent2: It is important to appropriate enough time for studying before the exam.
meanings.sent3: She decided to appropriate a portion of her allowance for charity.
meanings.sent4: The company will appropriate resources for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The team leader will appropriate tasks to each member for the assignment.
